comment.label_en: <center>Group generators are used to "Generate groups", "Set up group parents" and "Identify patterns for group names used in security models"<center>
This is the name that will be used in models to identify which groups should be assigned by combining the pattern in the group generator and the value(s) of the document attribute set in the tag.

Tags specified in the hierarchy are resolved and replaced within this string. This will then generate a group (if used during generation) or resolve to a specific group name to be used within a model.
The names of the generators for the groups that contain the groups generated here.

list.assistance_dql: select generator_name from lss_sec_group_gen where generator_name <> '$value(generator_name)' and generator_name not in (select generator_name from lss_sec_group_gen where any generator_parents = '$value(generator_name)') order by generator_name

comment.label_en: Check the "Use parent Generators for patterns" checkbox to have the group generator use the defined parent generators pattern. Otherwise add your own parent patterns as needed.
The pattern of the parent which will resolve based on the values for the current group – and then use that value as a parent group.
Pattern for the group that can invoke group administration from this group generator
The list of tags used in the generator, in the order they should be processed.

list.assistance_dql: select tag_name from lss_sec_tagdef order by tag_name

comment.label_en: Flag indicating if this generator should show up in the model pages.

boolean.label_en: Can be used in Security Models
